    A framework for SPAtial Transcriptomic Analysis: SPATA2







    Visualization

    Visualize gene expression, pathway enrichment and customized features within a spatial context to highlight areas of interest.

    Spatial trajectories

    Draw spatial trajectories and model gene epression of pathway activity within a directional context.


    Segmentation

    Dissect your samples into segments in order to compare different aspects across subregions of your choice.

    DE - Analysis

    Find and analyze differentially expressed genes across multiple regions and samples and visualize your results.



    Gene Set Enrichment Analysis

    Use hypergeometric testing for gene set enrichment analysis.



    Autoencoder Denoising

    Use state of the art neural networks to denoise your data and obtain more insightful visualization and downstream analysis results.




    Spatial Pseudotime Embedding

    Leverage monocle3 pseudotime within SPATA in order to analyse the transcriptional dynamics of your samples in a temporal and a spatial context at once.





    Trajectory modelling

    Find genes- and gene-sets whoose expression along trajectories resemble specific dynamics.



    Copy-Number-Variations

    Identify large-scale chromosomal gains and losses in data derived from malignancies.
